metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4933 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.Description:
The netmon_open function in wiretap/netmon.c in the Netmon file parser inWireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.9 and 1.10.x before 1.10.1 does not properlyallocate memory, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash) via a crafted packet-trace file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
